0.text: I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close.
0.author: Pablo Neruda

1.text: For every minute you are angry you lose sixty seconds of happiness.
1.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2.text: If you judge people, you have no time to love them.
2.author: Mother Teresa

3.text: Anyone who thinks sitting in church can make you a Christian must also think that sitting in a garage can make you a car.
3.author: Garrison Keillor

4.text: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye.
4.author: Jim Henson

5.text: Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one alive who is Youer than You.
5.author: Dr. Seuss

6.text: If you want your children to be intelligent, read them fairy tales. If you want them to be more intelligent, read them more fairy tales.
6.author: Albert Einstein

7.text: It is impossible to live without failing at something, unless you live so cautiously that you might as well not have lived at all - in which case, you fail by default.
7.author: J.K. Rowling

8.text: Logic will get you from A to Z; imagination will get you everywhere.
8.author: Albert Einstein

9.text: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
9.author: Bob Marley
